title: Cooperative Target Defense under Communication and Sensing Constraints
abstract:
We consider a variant of the target defense problems where a group of
defenders are tasked to simultaneously capture an intruder. The intruder's
objective is to reach a target without being simultaneously captured by the
defender team. Some of the defenders are sensing-limited and do not have any
information regarding the intruder's position or velocity at any time. The
defenders may communicate with each other using a connected communication
graph. We propose a decentralized feedback strategy for the defenders, which
transforms the simultaneous capture problem into a unique nonlinear consensus
problem. We derive a sufficient condition for simultaneous capture in terms of
the agents' speeds, sensing, and communication capabilities. The proposed
decentralized controller is evaluated through extensive numerical simulations.
subjects: Electrical Engineering and Systems Science/Systems and Control
